channel.title: How-to on Open Terms Archive documentation
channel.description: Recent content in How-to on Open Terms Archive documentation

item.title: Explore a history of versions
item.description: How to explore a history of versions Every public instance offers a public database of versions they recorded. For this guide, we will use the example of the Contrib instance. This instance publishes its history on the OpenTermsArchive/contrib-versions repository. From the repository page, open the folder of the service of your choice. For example, WhatsApp. You will see the set of documents tracked for that service, now click on the document of your choice.

item.title: Subscribe by RSS
item.description: Subscribe by RSS An RSS feed is a type of web page that contains information about the latest content published by a website, such as the date of publication and the address where you can view it. When this resource is updated, a feed reader app automatically notifies you and you can see the update. You can receive notification for a specific service or document by subscribing to RSS feeds.
